scenarioDescription:
The GJ 328 Exoplanetary System


Overview

GJ 328 is a star with 0.69 times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located 66.95 light years away from the solar system.

GJ 328 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the GJ 328 system


GJ 328 b

GJ 328 b was discovered by the McDonald Observatory observatory, in 2013-09, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 4.50 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of GJ 328 b is 731.400 times the mass of Earth. The radius of GJ 328 b is 13.300 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, GJ 328 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system GJ 328, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the McDonald Observatory.
name: GJ 328 - System With 1 Exoplanet
